attributes.action: Dismiss Chris Chope after his unrepresentative objection to the upskirting bill.
attributes.background: Upskirting is a horrendous act which at last was being legislated against. Chris Chope, however, has put parliamentary procedure ahead of allowing this bill to pass through the house. This is against the views of his constituents, who current have no means to dismiss him as their MP.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for removing MPs from office because of their views or opinions.

If you'd like the procedure of objecting to Bills to change, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/222338

If you'd like the law on upskirting to change, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/216290
